title: Chef De Piece, 1770–90
medium:
Medium: linen warp, cotton weft
Technique: block printed on plain weave
inscribed: Stamped impression in red at one end of fabric: " MBUCHOT AROUEN BON TEINT"within a curving frame and "PLF" within a circular frame. Handwritten in fading ink "21 1/2 aune". On the back in pale blue-gray, the letter "O". The pricipal identification mark may be read from two directions, up and down.
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Elinoe Merrell where it was No 16 on her list of chefs de piece.
description:
Polychrome scene of mounted rider and dog chasing a stag within a diagonal grid of ribbons and flowers. Colors are black, two reds, blue and dull yellow.
Repeat: arranged as a half-drop repeat.

tombstone.epitaph:
Chef De Piece, 1770–90.
1770–90. Medium: linen warp, cotton weft
Technique: block printed on plain weave. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-24.
